page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: The area around Sturry and Broad Oak is mainly mixed residential with farming and some light industury. The villages have grown and Sturry is a small dormitory town for Canterbury. The A28 to the coast bisects the lower village and carries a constant stream of heavy traffic-halted every half hour by hand operated railway crossing gates Pedestrians grumble and motorists fume. Beyond the busy village and main roads there are large lakes left by quarrying along the River Stour noted nationally as bird and wild life reserve.Eastwards light industries are grouped on an industrial estate designated for the purpose to the west of Canterbury. Beyond the villages the A28 is called the Island road and crosses rich drained mixed arable farmland as it carries tourists and foreign visitors into the Isle of Thanet and the coast.
